Articles.Content: I've put everything into the GameData folder and the MechJeb GUI doesn't even show up on my .23.5 version of KSP. Is there something I did wrong, or did I download the wrong one (MechJeb 2)? I play on steam, and I've watched numerous different tutorials. Thanks!
Is there a place where I COULD get mechjeb for .23.5?
Play without it or get a buggy dev release?
Is there a way to get MechJeb on .23.5 from spaceport or something that isn't buggy or something? I mean, I just want it, I've made landings on Tylo without it.
In the OP of the Mechjeb thread there are links to the dev releases.

Is there a way to get MechJeb on .23.5 from spaceport or something that isn't buggy or something? I mean, I just want it, I've made landings on Tylo without it.

There's no shame in relying on your computer to fly your ship. As for the question, no.
If you really want it you can always revert back to 0.23. It's done from the game properties in Steam.
Can someone give me a link to a version of mechjeb I could use for .23.5? That's all I'm looking for.
In the meantime, HyperEdit has been updated and should at least make a few things easier.

Can someone give me a link to a version of mechjeb I could use for .23.5? That's all I'm looking for.

SpaceGremlin post 7 already linked it for you. That's the latest there is.
The developer of MJ is on sabbatical so there is no new 'official' release. Use the dev builds, just like it says in the MJ thread.

Go to http://jenkins.mumech.com/job/MechJeb2/ and download the Mechjeb2.dll file (fixed for (0.23.5). If you want, make a backup of the existing Mechjeb2.dll file in your ...\Kerbal\GameData\MechJeb2\Plugins directory. Copy the new Mechjeb2.dll into the ...\GameData\MechJeb2\Plugins directory. Should be good to go.

Edited April 5, 2014 by steve58
corrected directory path

Wrong forum.

Huh, I thought this was the Add-on forum?

I thought it was a good question, exactly the same question I had

and the answers were equally good. I though something was wrong with my set-up since I had not previously installed mech prior to 23.5 and was not sure why it didn't work.
2.2 is now available from Spaceport: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/mechjeb/
